title_full: IOTOPS01-BP01 Conduct an OT and IT cybersecurity risk assessment using a common framework
title: Conduct an OT and IT cybersecurity risk assessment using a common framework
description: Evaluate governance and compliance requirements by conducting a comprehensive OT (Operational Technology) and IT cybersecurity risk assessment using a common framework. This enables organizations to identify, assess, and mitigate cybersecurity risks across both operational and information technology domains in a unified manner.

title_full: IOTOPS01-BP02 Evaluate if OT and IT teams use separate policies and controls to manage cybersecurity risks or if they use the same policy
title: Evaluate if OT and IT teams use separate policies and controls to manage cybersecurity risks or if they use the same policy
description: Assess whether your organization's OT and IT teams use unified or separate policies and controls for managing cybersecurity risks. Understanding this organizational structure helps determine the best approach for implementing consistent security practices across industrial IoT environments.

title_full: IOTOPS02-BP01 Consolidate resources into centers of excellence to bring focus to new or transforming enterprises
title: Consolidate resources into centers of excellence to bring focus to new or transforming enterprises
description: Establish a central cloud center of excellence (CCoE) with equivalent representation from OT and IT in industrial organizations. This ensures that both operational technology and information technology perspectives are considered when making architectural and operational decisions for IoT workloads.

title_full: IOTOPS03-BP01 Use static and dynamic device hierarchies to support fleet operations
title: Use static and dynamic device hierarchies to support fleet operations
description: Using a software registry, devices can be categorized into static groups based on their fixed attributes (such as version or manufacturer) and into dynamic groups based on their changing attributes (such as battery percentage or firmware version). Operationalizing devices in groups can help you manage, control, and search for devices more efficiently.

title_full: IOTOPS03-BP02 Use index and search services to enable rapid identification of target devices
title: Use index and search services to enable rapid identification of target devices
description: A large IoT deployment can have millions of sensors sending data to the cloud. A separate indexing and search service can make it straightforward to index and organize the device data, and search for devices by attributes. Ingesting device data to a search service makes it straightforward to use powerful search, visualization, and analytics capabilities to organize and search for devices.

title_full: IOTOPS04-BP01 The device management processes should be automated, data-driven, and based on previous, current, and expected device behavior
title: The device management processes should be automated, data-driven, and based on previous, current, and expected device behavior
description: Device management processes should be automated, data-driven, and based on previous, current, and expected device behavior. In AWS IoT, you can use multiple features to provision your individual device identities signed by your CA to the cloud. IoT applications must support incremental rollout and rollback strategies.

title_full: IOTOPS05-BP01 Document how devices join your fleet from manufacturing to provisioning
title: Document how devices join your fleet from manufacturing to provisioning
description: Document the whole device provisioning process to clearly define the responsibilities of different actors at different stages. The end-to-end device provisioning process involves multiple stages owned by different actors. Documenting the plan and processes by which devices onboard and join the fleet affords the appropriate amount of review for potential gaps.

title_full: IOTOPS05-BP02 Use programmatic techniques to provision devices at scale
title: Use programmatic techniques to provision devices at scale
description: Scaling the onboarding and provisioning of a large device fleet can be a bottleneck if there is even one manual step per device. Programmatic techniques define patterns of behavior for automating the provisioning process such that authenticated and authorized devices can onboard at any time.

title_full: IOTOPS05-BP03 Use device level features to enable re-provisioning
title: Use device level features to enable re-provisioning
description: A birth or bootstrap certificate is a low-privilege unique certificate that is associated with each device during the manufacturing process. Before a device is provisioned, it should be limited in functionality to help prevent its misuse. Only after a provisioning process is invoked and approved, should the device be allowed to operate on the system as designed.

title_full: IOTOPS06-BP01 Implement monitoring to capture logs and metrics
title: Implement monitoring to capture logs and metrics
description: Implement comprehensive monitoring to capture logs and metrics from your IoT system. Use AWS IoT Device Defender to monitor IoT configurations, audit device fleets, and detect anomalies. Enable logging to capture device connectivity, message routing, and authentication events.

title_full: IOTOPS06-BP02 Capture and monitor application performance at the edge
title: Capture and monitor application performance at the edge
description: Monitor application performance at the edge by collecting metrics from edge devices and gateways. Use AWS IoT Greengrass to deploy local compute, messaging, and data caching capabilities while maintaining the ability to monitor and manage edge applications centrally.

title_full: IOTOPS06-BP03 Monitor the status of your IoT devices
title: Monitor the status of your IoT devices
description: Monitor the operational status and health of your IoT devices including connectivity state, battery levels, firmware versions, and error conditions. Use device shadows and fleet indexing to track device state and enable efficient querying across large device fleets.

title_full: IOTOPS06-BP04 Use device state management services to detect status and connectivity patterns
title: Use device state management services to detect status and connectivity patterns
description: Use device state management services like AWS IoT Device Shadow to track and detect device status and connectivity patterns. Device shadows provide a reliable data store for device state that persists even when devices are intermittently connected.

title_full: IOTOPS07-BP01 Enable appropriate responses to events
title: Enable appropriate responses to events
description: Assess whether your IoT application meets operational goals by enabling appropriate responses to events. Configure rules and actions to automatically respond to device events, alerts, and anomalies detected in your IoT system.

title_full: IOTOPS07-BP02 Use data-driven auditing metrics to detect if any of your IoT devices might have been broadly accessed
title: Use data-driven auditing metrics to detect if any of your IoT devices might have been broadly accessed
description: Use data-driven auditing metrics to detect potential unauthorized broad access to IoT devices. Monitor access patterns and configure alerts for unusual activity that might indicate security concerns or operational issues.

title_full: IOTOPS08-BP01 Use static and dynamic device attributes to identify devices with anomalous behavior
title: Use static and dynamic device attributes to identify devices with anomalous behavior
description: Segment device operations by using static and dynamic device attributes to identify devices exhibiting anomalous behavior. This enables targeted troubleshooting and remediation of specific device groups without affecting the entire fleet.

title_full: IOTOPS09-BP01 Run ops metrics analysis across business teams, document learnings and define action items for future firmware deployments
title: Run ops metrics analysis across business teams, document learnings and define action items for future firmware deployments
description: Evolve your IoT application with minimum impact to downstream IoT devices by running operational metrics analysis across business teams, documenting learnings, and defining action items for future firmware deployments. This continuous improvement process helps optimize device updates and minimize disruptions.

title_full: IOTOPS10-BP01 Train team members supporting your IoT workloads on the lifecycle of IoT applications and your business objectives
title: Train team members supporting your IoT workloads on the lifecycle of IoT applications and your business objectives
description: Verify that you are ready to support the operations of devices in your IoT workload by training team members on the lifecycle of IoT applications and business objectives. This ensures operational readiness and effective incident response capabilities.
